pdhp342:1: An agitated, unsteady mind, difficult to guard, difficult to ward,
pdhp342:2: the sagacious one makes straight, as a fletcher does his arrows.
pdhp343:1: Like a fish thrown up on dry land, pulled out from its watery home,
pdhp343:2: the mind is agitated, one ought to throw off the sway of Māra.
pdhp344:1: Those who will restrain the mind that roams far,
pdhp344:2: is lonesome, without a body, hidden, gain release from the bonds of Māra.
pdhp345:1: For the mind that is difficult to subdue, flighty, flitting wherever it will,
pdhp345:2: restraint is good, a restrained mind brings happiness.
pdhp346:1: Hard to see, very subtle, flitting wherever it will,
pdhp346:2: the sage should guard the mind, for guarded it brings happiness.
pdhp347:1: For the one with mind that is not dependent, for the one with mind unperplexed,
pdhp347:2: having abandoned the wholesome and demerit, for the watchful, there is no fear.
pdhp348:1: The one who drinks the tasty Dhamma drink, with a clear mind,
pdhp348:2: the wise one will always delight in the Dhamma that is made known by the Noble.
pdhp349:1: Before long has passed by, alas, this body will lie on the ground,
pdhp349:2: rejected, without consciousness, just like a useless piece of wood.
pdhp350:1: Knowing this body is frail like a jar, govern the mind like a fortress,
pdhp350:2: one should fight Māra with the weapon of wisdom, guard your success, and do not be attached.
pdhp351:1: Just as the rain penetrates a house with thatching that is poor,
pdhp351:2: so passion penetrates a mind that is undeveloped.
pdhp352:1: Just as rain does not penetrate a house with thatching that is good,
pdhp352:2: so passion cannot penetrate a mind that is well-developed.
pdhp353:1: Just as the rain penetrates a house with thatching that is poor,
pdhp353:2: so hatred penetrates a mind that is undeveloped.
pdhp354:1: Just as rain does not penetrate a house with thatching that is good,
pdhp354:2: so hatred cannot penetrate a mind that is well-developed.
pdhp355:1: Just as the rain penetrates a house with thatching that is poor,
pdhp355:2: so delusion penetrates a mind that is undeveloped.
pdhp356:1: Just as rain does not penetrate a house with thatching that is good,
pdhp356:2: so delusion cannot penetrate a mind that is well-developed.
pdhp357:1: The non-doing of anything wicked, undertaking of what is good,
pdhp357:2: the training of one’s mind—this is the teaching of the Buddhas.
